item.title: Linux Configuration for UDP
item.description: Linux Configuration for UDP # If you are running your node on Linux, you might see warnings about the receive buffer size. UDP transfers on high-bandwidth connections can be limited by the size of the UDP receive buffer. This buffer holds packets that have been received by the kernel, but not yet read by the application. Once this buffer fills up, the kernel will drop any new incoming packet.
